doc.field: Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Subseries VI.C: New York City, State, and Congressional Elections
Subseries VI.C: New York City, State, and Congressional Elections

This subseries documents the city and state public office campaigns of members of the Communist Party of New York, as well as the work of the New York Committee to Elect Communist Candidates in the 1970s. Materials originating from Charlene Mitchell's 1988 bid for United States Senator can be found in this subseries; a small amount of material from the campaigns of some well-known party members, including Benjamin Davis and Simon Gerson are also present. Transcripts of the speeches delivered by Elizabeth Gurley Flynn, Robert Minor, and Earl Browder at a 1942 election rally at Madison Square Garden are particularly notable, as are copies of distribution materials from the 1930s.
